content: I've been using this app for a few years now. In my opinion it should be free. Not worth paying for. The barcode food finder feels like its never updated and the food list database is very limited. Paying for an app that counts down my 30 days is not worth paying for...
replyContent: Sorry to hear you are unsatisfied with the progress of the updates. We are doing our best to keep the app up to date and hope that features other than the countdown are useful. We will continue to try to improve the app. Thank you for your feedback.

content: I cannot get it to scan on my phone and bring up the information I need to know for my diet
There is no recipes or to save to app

Not great. The "Label Reader" is really buggy, and hard to read. I wish I could attach a photo to show how bad it is. Kind of surprising that it is being sold this way. I have scanned several items and been wrongly told "Whole30 approved!" When using the Label Reader, I recommend moving the ingredients list to the very top of the screen, otherwise it is an incomprehensible muddle of moving boxes and illegible words. Really messy. Lots of room for improvement.
Makes whole30 easier
Love the scanner for prepared food!
replyContent: Great to hear, Ben! Thank you for your review. Let us know what we can do to make it a 5 star!

content: This app has an overall poor design. Not even worth the $2 I spent to purchase it. The interface makes it hard to trust because it seems to have multiple misspellings. And it doesnt offer a whole lot of assistance when shopping.
Awesome tool
The new label reader is AMAZING! I was very excited today to find the new label reader. This will make a huge difference in having a successful 4th Whole30!

almost nothing i scan comes up from any health food store. which is some of the only places i can get anything from. the iphone version works on some of the items that don't work on mine but i don't have an iphone.
replyContent: Hello, sorry to hear this. Have you tried the text reader function? This allows you to scan any label for compliance without relying on the barcode. If you still are not satisfied, please feel free to request a refund. Thank you for your feedback.

content: Not worth the money, even though it's on $2. The App doesnt work. It does go past your Start Date.
replyContent: Hello, what is not working for you? Please reach out to our support team at 30wholedays@gmail.com and we are happy to help.

content: 75% of barcodes scanned are not found. not helpful.
replyContent: Hello, sorry to hear this. Have you tried the text reader function? This allows you to scan any label for compliance without relying on the barcode. If you still are not satisfied, please feel free to request a refund. Thank you for your feedback.

content: I just bought this app in preparation for a second attempt at Whole30 (seriously only about 10 minutes ago), and there are already things I don't love about it. Why can't I choose an upcoming start date? That seems like a basic countdown function, or that you could provide tips to be successful through preparation. I also hate the recipe part of the app. Once I get into Instagram to look at "recipes" it is impossible to back out of Instagram and get back to the Whole30 app.
replyContent: Hello, sorry to hear this. You can set the countdown in the future, but since you aren't in the future yet, it won't start counting down until you get there.  This is good feedback though, we didn't assume people would want to countdown until they actually start. Thank you. We will look into your comments about the recipes. Thank you.

content: I have found a good many items that won't register to give the compliance yes or no. Since I paid for this app, I was under the misconception it would register everything. My error. The "fine" print - or any print, should have given the caveat. Other than that, seems ok (I have only been using this for 2 weeks.)
replyContent: Hello, sorry to hear this. Have you tried the text reader function? This allows you to scan any label for compliance without relying on the barcode. If you still are not satisfied, please feel free to request a refund. Thank you for your feedback.

content: This has to be the worst app I've ever purchased. None of the products I scan can be found and when they do "find" it, it provides a long list that you have to read through to find the exact product. I try to read the label and it's just an bunch of scattered words that keep changing and while I'm holding the product its difficult to "pinch the screen" to get an accurate reading. Myfitnesspal is 1000% better and it's free. I bought this yesterday and wish I could get my money back...
replyContent: Hello, so sorry to hear this. We have not had this feedback from other users. Please feel free to request a refund through the app store. Thank you!

content: I bought this app yesterday and started the Whole 30 today - so far I've not been able to set my start date which is very frustrating as the spinner is counting backwards - makes no sense! I'd love it if there was a feature to track your food, something not unlike myfitnessspal. I like the scanner and reader - can't really rate them as I haven't used them yet and don't know if I will be able to if I can't get past the date setup page. Has anyone any advice on this?
replyContent: Hi Tara, I'm sorry to hear you are having troubles with the app. The spinner is intended to be set to your start date and then left alone. You will then see your daily countdown on the home page based on whatever your start date is. If you need more help please reach out to us at 30wholedays@gmail.com and we would be happy to assist. Thank you!

content: i appreciate the inspiration but would be grateful for more practical tips. also a qr reader would be good for store bought items instead of the lable reader
replyContent:
Hi Suzi,
Thanks for reaching out. We can add some more practical tips as requested. Also, the app does have a barcode reader in addition to the label reader. Is this what you are looking for? If not, please reach out to us so we can better understand your needs. Thanks!

content: This app has made whole30 so much easier. I have never paid for an app but I am so glad I paid for this one! I love that it will even read the labels for you. You truly get your money's worth on this one.
replyContent: Hello, thanks so much for your positive review! Not many people take the time to write such a nice review, so we really appreciate it! Glad you are enjoying the app so much.

content: Could never get to work, never could get start date set and basically linked to Instagram for recipes. Waste of money.
ok
Love this app. So helpful! ðŸ˜Š
I like how you can just scan food to check and see if it is compliant, but thats about all you can do.

This app is useless. almost everything I typed in would not be in the database. when i scanned it, sometimes it would work, but most of the time it didn't, and I would get this message basically telling me to check the label.
replyContent: Hello, sorry to hear you are experiencing issues. We just pushed an update to the app that allows label text to be read if the barcode isn't found. I hope this makes your experience better!

content: Making my start to Whole30 much easier. Excellent ingredient checker, making shopping much easier when checking the various sulphates, nitrates and carbonates
recipes aren't searchable
it isnt keeping track of the right day. when i put in the day i started it is a day off.

bought it for the barcode scanner, but doesn't read all barcodes. I shop at Trader Joe's all the time and cannot easily decide if it is Whole 30 or not. Didn't care too much for the updated version of the Instagram recipes. Preferred the old version to filter through recipes. Would like to see some sample meal preps for each meal in a given day. Also, could add a section of some do's and don'ts of the Whole 30.

I wish there was a way to track your meals, similar to Fitbit or My Fitness Pal. Also, I thought the start date part was strange. It could be improved by having the Whole30 calendar letting you know what you might feel which day and tracking which day you are on.
Great tool for knowing what to expect
so far so good!
not very helpful
replyContent: Sorry to hear this. Could you please reach out to us directly at 30wholedays@gmail.com and tell us why you find the app isn't helpful so we can make it better? Otherwise you can request a refund through the app store.  Thanks!

content: I can't get past the start page! App says yesterday was day 1, and there's no way to actually select any date regardless of which I spin to and choose. it also appears to countdown backwards, eg says Jan 2 2019 is day one, and the final day is December 3rd 2018. I have a Samsung galaxy 6.
replyContent: Hello, I'm so sorry to hear this. If you email us at 30wholedays@gmail.com we will help you trouble shoot this. One thing you can try in the meantime is changing your start date to something in the future, and then going back to your desired start date. Leave the spinner alone and then navigate to the home screen to see if it updated.

content: OK for first timers

Just started using this in preparation for when I start my Whole30. Off hand, I really like this app. One thing that I do think could be improved upon though: it would be nice to have filters for the recipes. For instance, I HATE eggs, but If I search for breakfasts most recipes will have eggs... So it would be nice to be able to filter those out. That make sense?
it's really nice knowing at a glance what is complaint and what's not. Easy recipes are a plus!
Love it, but I wish I could bookmark recipes.
replyContent: Thanks for the positive review! We will work to incorporate bookmarking recipes in the next release. Thank you!

content: Loved the scanner for shopping for compliant foods.
Great for scanning products. Unable to adjust start date.

This app has saved me lots of time and frustration when I go shopping for Whole30 compliant foods. Whole30 is challenging enough without having to try to read every single ingredient on different products.
Did not work for me at all. Could not find item 90% pf the time. Waste of $1.99 save your money
replyContent:
Hello,
Sorry to hear this. Where are you located? Or what stores do you typically shop at? This is odd behavior. I would love to help troubleshoot. Please email us at 30wholedays@gmail.com. In addition, you may request a refund for the app through the app store. Sorry for your troubles.

content:
This app is great. It takes most of the guess work out of shopping. It was 
also very helpful in helping me clear the pantry of items I couldn't have. 
Equipped with a day tracker and lots of recipes this app turned out to be 
quite the little helper.
replyContent: Thanks for the positive review! So glad you are enjoying the app!

content: This app have been very helpful why I enjoy the whole 30 diet!

Unable to actually use the app. Wont go past the start date screen. I put 
in the date and it will not save. Tried to un install and reinstall still 
nothing. Really disappointed especially for a paid app.
replyContent: I am trying to reproduce your issue and I am not able to. Are you able to click on the menu? The start date saves automatically when you change it. Please reach out to us at 30wholedays@gmail.com and we will help you resolve this (otherwise you can request a refund through the app store). No other users seem to be experiencing this issue.

content: Awesome
replyContent: Thanks so much for the positive review! Glad you are enjoying the app!

content: Like it and helpful overall. Scanner can't find major items/brands you think it would (i.e., V8, Minute Maid orange juice, etc) yet does find some items you think it wouldn't (not everything though - which isn't totally unsurprising). Told a family member about the app (she is apple I am android)... her apple app shows Heintz no sugar ketchup as approved and my android version says it is not and the apple counts down days different than my android version... thus is app perfect? No it is not, yet it is a helpful app.

Not worth the 2 bucks in my opinion. I had to download a separate barcode scanner app and even then, it doesn't scan or when it does, this app doesn't recognize the product. Typing product names didn't yield better results and their list of ingredients wasn't extensive. Plus it's annoying, for example, to type in red grapes and get no hits, but grapes is fine. I usually just google the information now ðŸ¤·
Its okay. I like that you can scan for compliant foods but for having to pay for the app I wish there was more to it.
Helps track compliant foods for W30
replyContent: Thanks for the positive review, Heather! Glad you are enjoying the app.

content: My friend and I started a day apart and the countdown says we are on the same day on mine no matter how many times I change it, uninstall and reinstall.
replyContent:
Hi Avriel,
Sorry to hear you having issues. This is the first we have heard of this happening. I would love to help you troubleshoot if I can get a little more information. Do you two have the same type of phone? Is there any way the app's cached data was cleared? (i.e if you try to save memory on your phone and clear app data)

content: This app has been so helpful!
It's okay. Not great. Worth 1.99.
Worst app I've ever seen.
replyContent: Sorry you are unhappy. You can request a refund through the app store

content: Really useful app. When shopping, I use frequently.  Had about 90% of my items or ingredients. Bar codes worked about 20% of three time.
replyContent: Thanks so much for your positive review! Glad you are enjoying the app! We are working on getting more barcodes for certain stores and locations. Hopefully those updates will come soon. Thanks again!

content: Start date doent work, recipes aren't even foe whole 30....
replyContent: I would love to help troubleshoot.Try changing your start date to a new day, and then change it back to the start date you desire.This will reset it.Make sure the recipe has the green 'W' symbol indicating whole30.Users have requested support for multiple recipes (i.e. paleo) so if you navigate away from the main whole30 recipes you may see others

content: Nothing to like about this app because it is barely developed. Don't waste your money.
replyContent: Hello! Sorry that you feel this way about the app. Could you please explain what you aren't satisfied with so that we can help improve? Also, feel free to request a refund via the Google Play store. We want our customers to be satisfied. Thank you for your feedback!

content: All the recipes are from skinny taste, which I could get off the site. The start date setting doesn't even work.
replyContent: Sorry to hear you aren't satisfied. Recipes were added after users requested having recipes and our ingredient searches in one place. As far as the start date, feel free to contact us with any troubleshooting needs; but in the meantime, please try to move your start date forward a day, and then back to the desired start date. This should reset it.

content: Sure has helped a lot
replyContent: Dona, Thank you so much for your positive review! Glad to hear the app is helping you.

content: Not a helpful tool for the actual "whole30" plan, would not recommend.
replyContent: Hi Tiffany, could you please share with us what makes the app 'not a helpful tool' for the Whole30? We strive to make our app the best possible, but in order to do so, more specific details would be much appreciated.  Thank you!

content: I liked it at first but now no matter what barcode I scan or what i type i keep getting no items match???
replyContent: Hello, sorry to hear this is happening for you. I would love to help you trouble shoot this issue. Was the scanner and typed search working before for you? I'm assuming you are connected to the internet as well?

content: I liked it. Easy to use. Provides quick guidance for those hard to read labels. The warnings are nice as they make you think before buying a product. Thanks for making this app
replyContent: Thank you for your review! Glad that the app is helping you with those tricky labels!

content: Was at trader Joe's trying to scan several products and couldn't get this app to work properly. Tried to scan rxbars (scanner wouldn't work), scanned chili Verde sauce (couldn't find it in the database), scanned clarified butter (couldn't find, did a search and still couldn't locate item). Useless app so far.
replyContent: Dan, so sorry you are having scanner issues. Could you provide us with some more info so we can fix the issue for you? I.e is there certain grocery stores or products in particular that aren't being found? Thanks for the input. we will do our best to fix this.

content: I installed this app as I was going into Whole Foods.   I scanned the Primal Kitchen Honey Mustard and it had the check mark beside it and all of three ingredients including honey listed.  After I got home I found out honey is NOT compliant.  Ugh.  What a waste of time and money on all accounts!
replyContent: Hi Yvette, sorry for this experience. We will fix this ASAP. Honey is in the database for unapproved items (it shows up in the ingredient search.) Not sure why you experienced this issue, but we will find out and fix it. Again, very sorry.

content: Bought this app b/c of scanner which does not work. Waisted $1.99
replyContent: Hi Sheri, so sorry you aren't satisfy. The scanner isn't working at all? Could you provide any more details so we can determine if the issue is just with your phone? We want to fix this and make sure it is working for you. Thanks!

content: The database doesn't have items from Aldi unfortunately.
replyContent: Hi Maggie, we have tested several items from Aldi and they are recognized. Sometimes the food is rebranded and doesn't find an exact match with the USDA database. I would advise trying to type the item into the search versus the scanner. Sorry for any inconveniences! Hoping to get this resolved for you.

content: It sucks!!
replyContent: Hi Rhonda, sorry you are not happy with the app. It would be great if you could tell us why. Many users have been very happy with the app and we would like to keep it that way. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!

content: It has recipes but no way to add them to the shopping list
replyContent: This is a great idea, thanks for the suggestion! We will consider a way to add recipe ingredients to the shopping list.  Hope you are enjoying the other app features!

content: Great app! Used it a bunch of times before even going to the store. Found a lot of items in my pantry were not W3 compliant.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback! Good to hear you're finding the app useful!

content: This has made doing this way easier I dont have to search labels when grocery shopping. Just scan and done. Great app!
replyContent: Thanks so much for your positive feedback! So glad the app is making the Whole 30 easier for you! Please let us know if you have suggestions to make it better! Thanks for taking the time to rate :)

content: This app is great.  I would study the ingredients over and over and still be afraid the product wouldn't be Whole30 compliant. This gives me the reassurance that I am making the right choices. I love this app!
replyContent: Thanks so much for the positive feedback! Glad your experience has been easier and  you are more confident  making food decisions! Thanks for sharing!

content: When trying a new lifestyle it can be very discouraging and you will want to give up. This app has made it possible for me to stay on the plan and use less time trying to find things in the grocery store. Without it I would of never made it past my first week. Now Im in my 4th week and still going strong. Thank you for such an awesome life changing app!
replyContent: LaShawnda, this review made my day! Thank you! I am so glad that this app has made such a positive impact for you. The feedback is much appreciated!

content: This app makes whole 30 much easier - it makes the grocery store a lot less stressful
Some inconsistencies with compliance.   For example, Kerrygold butter is not compliant.  Contains milk/cream.   This app says it is compliant.   I've trusted the app but discover this on day 19.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! Fixed this bug in release 13.5.5. In addition, I have added the capability of seeing all ingredients for approved items, this allows a double check that we didn't miss anything. I apologize for this issue. I hope the quick resolution will ensure you the integrity of the app and you will consider updating your review.

content: Have found this app extremely useful when grocery shopping. It is super easy / user friendly. Storing a user's history (items searched) for future reference might be a cool add-on. Twice the app had no information for two products; I used my best judgment.
replyContent: Thanks so much for your feedback! We will work on adding a historical view of searches. As for the missing information on products, sometimes if the item is not registered with the USDA the only thing we can do is provide similar items and their ingredients.

content: I think the app is helpful. But sometimes pulls up of an item that you scanned incorrectly. I scanned a ftozen fish, and it pulled up a fish stick. The item was not a fish stick. However it is helpful to use as another tool when in the grocery store and you're not sure whether the item has chemicals.
replyContent: I appreciate the feedback! The reason you are experiencing the issue with the fish stick is because when an item is not registered with the USDA we try to provide you with a similar item to compare to. Glad you are finding the tool useful.

content: 8.37.17 please add canola oil as Not approved /11/17 Update: I'm changing my review as what I experienced was a fluke! I scanned several items today and it worked great!  Found out my Almond milk and my coconut milk were both noncompliant!!  Thanks much!
replyContent: Thanks for the update! I appreciate the feedback, however canola oil is "technically" approved, but should be limited. I will add a warning for canola oil. Whole 30 says they "encourage you to limit your use of oils (like safflower, sunflower, canola, grapeseed, or sesame) at home, while not specifically excluding them on the program."

content: Great feature for checking bar codes for compliance!
replyContent: Thank you so much for the review! So glad to hear you are happy with the app.

content: Nice starter app, but I have scanned a lot of things and they are not in the database. Very disappointing when I am shopping and need help.
replyContent: I appreciate your feedback.Could you please let me know some of the items you have scanned that have not returned data? You are the first user so far that has told me of this experience, so I would be curious to see what foods are being scanned.The app searches the USDA database.That said, I apologize you are not completely satisfied with the app.

content: It's ok. Would be the recipes worked differently. It redirects me to log into instagram and I have no clue what my password is. I just go to pinterest instead. I also seem to be having minor issues with the scanner, but when that fails I run through the ingredient list manually.

It would be 1000 times better for the recipes to be hooked to pinterest rather than instagram.  The date should include doing a 30 count down and being a food diary where you take pictures of your food and then list to help you track and it would be great if it allowed you to enter the approx. Amount of food and totaled the calories. Also if it let you do a modified version. So if you have a food allwrgy to avoid or if you have a specific food you need (like personally I have to have dairy for bone healing right now if you could say modify with (whole)dairy  or skim dairy etc. The recipe section just being instagram search was a huge disappointment ðŸ˜• My friend used an app for whole 30 a year ago. I don't think it was this one.
replyContent: Hi Rachel, thank you for your feedback! The app originally used Pinterest, but unfortunately Pinterest does not support login through the app, and we thought it to be a obnoxious if the recipes section was always re-directing to another app. Your ideas are great, and we will try to incorporate them ASAP -- For sure the count down idea - love it!

content: It's already a good app; but also still has a ton of untapped potential!
replyContent: Thank you Shaun! If you have ideas for this "untapped potential", feel free to email us at 30wholeDays@gmail.com - We would be happy to incorporate them. Thanks for the great feedback!

content: Not accurate!! Cheese is NOT approved!  Not sure what else you are telling people is Whole30 approved. Look up 365 Havarti Cheese
replyContent: I really appreciate the feedback. This bug has been fixed in release 13.5.4. You should receive an update to the app within the next hour. Thanks again for your help in making this app better. I apologize for the inconvenience. I hope you will consider updating the review if you are satisfied with the app after this fix. Thanks again!

content: The app is a good resource for food choices for whole 30 but doesn't seem to help keep track of progress being made or even a day count down feature.
replyContent: Hi Carlie, thanks for the feedback! What would your ideal progress tracker look like? What kind of progress goals would you find meaningful to track? I will work on adding one if you can give me some additional feedback. The count down feature is a great idea! I will incorporate that.

content: INACCURATE Ingredient list!!!!! Recipe section inaccessible despite entering my Instagram login information correctly. Rate Me nag screen was constantly popping up.
replyContent: Hi Dawn, I'm sorry you are not happy with the app. The recipes do not require login, and you should have the option to dismiss the pop-up eternally if you select 'no thanks'. Would you be willing to expand on which ingredients you find inaccurate? This way I can be sure to fix it. Feel free to email 30WholeDays@gmail.com. Thank you!

content: I just started using the app. May change the rating later. Just a suggestion: maybe get a rating after 5 uses?
replyContent:
Hi Anna, 
Just writing to let you know that I did incorporate your feedback to get a rating after 5 uses. I really appreciate your suggestion! I hope you are enjoying using the app. If so, I would really appreciate you updating your rating accordingly. If not, please let me know what else I can do to make the app better. Thanks again!

content: Makes whole 30 a lot easier!
replyContent: Thanks so much for the great review, Tina! Please let me know if you have ideas to make the app even better and I will try my best to incorporate them!

content: Really helpful prging my cupboard!
replyContent: Thanks so much for the positive feedback, Karyn! I'm glad you are enjoying the app. Please feel free to email me directly if you have any new ideas or feedback for the app.

content: Just started, may change my rating later.
replyContent: Hi Margaret - Just checking in to see how your experience has been with the app. If you wouldn't mind updating your rating now that you've used the app, that would be greatly appreciated!

content: Good app for searching foods
replyContent: Thank you, Linda! Your review means a lot! If you ever have any suggestions to make the app better, please email me! I try to update the app weekly.  I appreciate the positive review! I am planning to add a barcode scanner this week, I am just finishing up the database for it. I hope that will bring your 4 star review up to a 5! :-) thanks again!
